basics.name: Michael Juniper
basics.label: Principal Software Developer
basics.summary:
I am a mostly front-end web developer, though I've done some back end stuff in the past. In recent years my particular focus has been on "front of the front end" - where HTML, CSS, & Javascript come together to produce the UI that users experience.

The data for this resume is stored in JSON format which is used to generate this HTML page. See [the repo](https://github.com/mjuniper/mikejuniper).

work.name: Esri
work.summary: I lead a team of developers building [ArcGIS Hub](https://www.esri.com/en-us/arcgis/products/arcgis-hub/overview). I build UI using Ember.js & Stenciljs but I have my eye on the full stack.

work.name: DTS Agile
work.summary: I architected and built fairly complex web applications for state DOTs. I often also served as a technical project manager with frequent client contact. I occasionally supervised junior developers. The apps I built usually dealt with management or visualization of traffic data or highway construction projects. There was typically a mapping component; sometimes it was central to the app, sometimes not.
highlights: Online Transportation Information System (OTIS) - Colorado Department of Transportation: A public facing portal for disseminating CDOT's traffic count and highway data to the public.
Traffic Analysis Geospatial Information System (TAGIS) - Colorado Department of Transportation
Interactive Funding Map - National Center for Safe Routes to School: A web mapping application which visualizes federally funded Safe Routes to Scholl projects across the US.

work.name: Sanborn Map Company
work.summary: Served as a member of a team building desktop applications for government clients utilizing Microsoft .NET and ESRI ArcObjects.

work.name: Ramsey County Surveyor's Office
work.summary: Developed various ArcGIS extensions to automate colleague's tasks. Served as guest lecturer on ArcGIS at St Paul College.
